Board

Description

Board. All actions to do with the board the player can do.

Documentation

data Col

Data type representing the turn.

Constructors

Black 
White 
Empty 

Instances

Eq Col 
Read Col 
Show Col 

other :: Col -> Col

Function to swap the colour to the opposite.

type Position = (Int, Int)

Type specifying what a Position is.

data Board

A Board is a record containing the board size (a board is a square grid, n * n), the number of pieces in a row required to win, and a list of pairs of position and the colour at that position.

Constructors

Board 

Fields

size :: Int

The size of the board.

target :: Int

The target of pieces to get in a line.

pieces :: [(Position, Col)]

All the pieces on the board.

Instances

Eq Board 
Read Board 
Show Board 

initBoard :: Board

The initial Board used to reset the game to defaults.

data World

Overall state is the board and whose turn it is, plus any further information about the world.

Constructors

World

If a hint has been asked for. deriving(Show)

The board of the game.

Instances

Show World

Making a custom show function for the World Data type

makeMove

Arguments

:: Board

The current Board.

-> Col

Who's turn it currently is.

-> Position

The Positon of the move the player wants to make.

-> Maybe Board

Either the updated Board or Nothing.

Play a move on the board; return Nothing if the move is invalid (e.g. outside the range of the board, or there is a piece already there).

restartGame

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The newly reset world.

Restart and reset the game to its default settings.

changeImage

Arguments

:: World

The current world

-> World

The new updted world

Swap the picture being displayed on the screen between bitmap images and simple gloss images.

increaseBoardSize

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The newly increased size world.

Incearse the number of squares on the game board.

decreaseBoardSize

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The newly decreased size world.

Decrease the number of squares on the game board.

increaseLineSize

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The newly increased target world.

Increase the target line length to get to win the game, onlt if the curretn line length is '3'.

decreaseLineSize

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The newly decreased target world.

Decrease the target line length to get to win the game, onlt if the curretn line length is '5'.

undoMove

Arguments

:: World

The current World.

-> World

The world without the most two most recent moves.

Undo the players last move, this also undos the AI's most recent move.

checkWon

Arguments

:: Board

The current board.

-> Maybe Col

Returns Nothing if neither player has won yet. Returns 'Just c' if the player c has won.

Check whether the board is in a winning state for either player.

checkForDefence

Arguments

:: (Position, Col)

The last move made on the board, the move played by the opposite colour.

-> Col

The current colour of whose turn it is.

-> Board

The current board.

-> Bool

True if the player is one away from winning, otherwise false.

Function for seeing if the oppisite colour is one away from getting the target length of pieces in a line.

getPiecesForColor

Arguments

:: Board

The current board.

-> Col

The colour to search for.

-> [(Position, Col)]

List of Positions and Colour.

Gets all the Positions on the board where the specified colour has pieces.

evaluate

Arguments

:: Board

The current board.

-> Col

The colour to evaluate for.

-> Int

If there is a winning line then 5, if it stops the other colour from winner it gets 4, if there are two pieces in a row of the same colour then 2, otherwise 1.

Evaluate how good the board is for the specified colour.
